required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Performance of NIPT in Multiple Gestation Pregnancies
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance of NIPT (Noninvasive Prenatal Testing) in Multiple Gestation Pregnancies (SCMM-T21-110)

collaborator.agency: Sequenom, Inc/Laboratory Corporation of America Holdings

brief_summary.textblock: This study plans to evaluate the clinical performance of the MaterniT21 PLUS and/or GENOME Laboratory Developed Test, in the detection of fetal trisomy 21 in circulating cell-free DNA extracted from maternal blood samples obtained from women pregnant with a twin gestation.

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of sensitivity of NIPT detection of trisomy 21 among a population of women with twin gestations.
primary_outcome.time_frame: time from maternal blood draw to delivery

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of specificity of NIPT detection of trisomy 21 among a population of women with twin gestations.
primary_outcome.time_frame: time from maternal blood draw to delivery

intervention.intervention_name: MaterniT21 PLUS and GENOME Laboratory-Developed Tests
intervention.description: Both the MaterniT21 PLUS and GENOME are intended for use as laboratory developed test that analyze ccfDNA extracted from a maternal blood sample utilizing Massively Parallel Sequencing (MPS) technology.

study_pop.textblock: The Study Population will consist of women 18 years of age and older who underwent testing with a Sequenom NIPT, were pregnant with a multiple gestation at the time of testing and whose pregnancies should have outcome based upon gestational age at the time of testing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subject pregnant with a multiple gestation and received NIPT from Sequenom Laboratories;
- subject was 18 or older at the time of NIPT
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
